English: I'm fed up with your {{1::constant}} complaining.
French: Je suis excédé par vos plaintes incessantes.

English: Flowers are yellow.
French: Les fleurs sont {{1::jaunes}}.

English: The {{1::pirates}} had no choice but to surrender.

English: Did you go to the doctor?
French: {{1::t'es-tu}} rendu chez le médecin ?

English: Russia is the {{1::largest}} country in the world.
French: La russie est le pays le plus étendu du monde.

English: The situation will {{1::surely}} improve.
French: La situation va sûrement s'améliorer.

French: À quand {{1::remonte}} votre opération ?

English: Do you have a bowl for soup?
French: Est-ce que tu as un {{1::bol}} pour la soupe ?

French: En {{1::entendant}} cela, il est devenu pâle.

English: Before, he would go to the {{1::firm}} on foot.

English: He put forward a plan for improving the rate of {{1::production}}.

English: You can't say no.

French: Les feuilles sont {{1::tombées}}.

French: Tes cheveux {{1::sentent}} le printemps.

English: I don't usually eat at places like this.

English: Human beings {{1::communicate}} in many ways.
